experience.position: Head of Studies for International Academy
experience.responsibilities: I designed and managed the service website using WordPress, focusing on usability, content structure, and user experience. I designed, led, and coordinated training programs, integrating digital tools and innovative learning solutions. I supervised teams and managed projects, including recruitment, HR tasks, and collaborative workflow organization.

experience.position: French as a Foreign Language Teacher
experience.organization: ENSAM, JUNIA, ComUE, University of Lille
experience.responsibilities: I designed and delivered engaging learning sequences, both in-person and online, using a variety of digital tools to enhance interactivity and accessibility. I promoted intercultural awareness to support diverse learners and foster inclusive environments, while also assessing language proficiency to adapt instruction to individual needs. This role strengthened my ability to communicate complex ideas clearly, manage digital content effectively, and create user-centered experiences-skills that directly inform my work as a web developer.

As a corporate travel agent, I mastered and trained others in using major GDS systems such as Amadeus, Sabre, and Galileo, ensuring efficient and accurate reservation management. I maintained strong client relationships and communicated seamlessly with international partners in English, French, and Polish. My role required quick thinking and problem-solving to resolve urgent travel issues under pressure — skills that sharpened my ability to manage complex systems, deliver reliable solutions, and communicate effectively across diverse teams, all of which now support my transition into web development.
